spots.name: Cedar River
spots.notes:
Nice place, but humidity is insanely high on 20230811.

Hotspot internet is great 42/16.

People come here for boating and fishing.

The sun rises in your face across the river.

Gorgeous ecosystem

spots.name: Missouri River in Oacoma
spots.notes:
Awesome! Good signal! Very cloes to the town, but even closer to the river.

I only stayed for a night, but staying seven days for work was certainly a good option.

The sign says 7 days maximum.

spots.name: Missouri River in Oacoma
spots.notes:
Awesome! Good signal! Very cloes to the town, but even closer to the river.

I only stayed for a night, but staying seven days for work was certainly a good option.

The sign says 7 days maximum.

spots.name: Kinbasket Lake (north)
spots.notes:
Gorgeous place. Easy to access. Phenomenal views. Access to lake.

Signal was very weak signal in the evening, but it was great in the morning. I didn't stay long enough to say more about it.

I absolutely regret not staying longer. It was a better location than in Jasper and Banff, because this place has way less people.

spots.name: Beaverfoot Forest Service Rd
spots.notes: Weird spot, but ok for one night. Bad hotspot signal 0.18/2.65, but manageable for browsing and light work. Meetings would be crap.

spots.name: Naramata
spots.notes:
Nice place to stay and to sleep if you are fine with many people from Quebec passing by.

Place for hikers and bikers. Good signal. Good views in some parts.

The one place with a good view was taken by what seems to be a local resident.

spots.name: Pelican on Yellowstone River
spots.notes:
5 spots.
Weak signal 1.23/.74.
Can hear I-90.
Access to river.
Can hear train when it passes.

spots.name: Loon Lake
spots.notes:
Great view of the lake and sunrise. Good signal.

Possible to go down closer to the lake, but I didn't, because there were people already.
Awesome deserted place. Great for working and chilling. Come from the west, because the road from the east can leave you stuck.
Just for a night. Boring place.
Slept at this spot until appointment with mechanic across the street, Meineke.

Multiple spots. Signal 4.32/0.08
Bear country.
Forest with trees for hammock.
Big large area with signal here. Signal in other spots can be unreliable.

Decent signal
6 reviews 4.7. Multiple spots.
Good signal here. It was difficult to find a place with signal in the region.

Good signal. Only this spot. One other spot full of sand.

Nice lake

Very secret. Stayed for 5 minutes just to see if there was anything better.

spots.name: Alabama Hills
spots.notes:
This specific spot: best spot I found with a good hotspot signal.

ATT 26/3
T-Mobile 7/0.5

Beware: lots of places marked for day use only.

spots.name: Alice Lake
spots.notes:
Absolutely wonderful place. Awesome location if there is room by the lake and if you have satellite internet.

Impossible to work with hotspot. Signal sucks crap.

spots.name: Badlands
spots.notes: Highest point on this side.

spots.name: Badlands
spots.notes: Best spot for privacy and elevation. Good signal.

spots.name: Badlands
spots.notes:
Great signal.
Closest point to walk over the canyon a little.
Lots of people.
Great views all over all day.

spots.name: Bayou Segnette State Park
spots.notes: Paid to stay at this campground close to New Orleans for a few days. Saw an armadillo.

spots.name: Black Rock
spots.notes: Good open space. Good signal.

spots.name: Blackwell Horsecamp
spots.notes: Trees around an open area where people camp. Good hotspot.

spots.name: Bonneville Salt Flats
spots.notes:
Good signal, but try the open area on the “corner” just a minute south first.

Isolated spot, beautiful view of the salt flats. Somewhat protected from the wind. A hike up to the mountains starts right there.

Good ATT cellular signal.
Little traffic on the gravel road

Due to being so close to the mountain, sunset is not visible here.

spots.name: Bonneville Salt Flats
spots.notes:
Good signal.

Beautiful view of the salt flats. Lots of wind in the morning, evening and night.

Beautiful sunrise and sunset.

spots.name: Burtons Shore Beach
spots.notes:
Beautiful sunrise.

Not a lot of space, but I was lucky to be the only one there. I would not have stayed if there was already someone here.

spots.name: Carson City
spots.notes: Presence of gun shells and good hotspot signal. Nice overview of the city. Nice to stay for one night only.

spots.name: Chincoteague Island Waterman's Memorial
spots.notes: Marina parking lot with beautiful sunset.

spots.name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
spots.notes: Parked right under the tree for one night.

spots.name: Deadwood - Mt Roosevelt Rd (best spot)
spots.notes: Great signal. Two spots up here, both with great views. Great sunrise.

spots.name: Deadwood - Mt Roosevelt Rd
spots.notes: Another good spot. This one offers privacy.

spots.name: Dominguez - Entrance
spots.notes:
This entrance has less people, but it is rocky-ish from the start.

There is a better entrance not far south.

spots.name: Dominguez - Escalante
spots.notes: Better entrance and easier access to a lot of spots.

spots.name: Dominguez
spots.notes:
Arrived at 2000. Very windy. Can't leave anything outside. Only two vans within sight. Far enough for privacy.

Great spot overlooking canyon and river.

Hotspot internet 41/6.

spots.name: Edenton
spots.notes: Nice little town. There is a parking lot and street parking. Beautiful sunset.

spots.name: Fire Rd 310, in the Grand Canyon
spots.notes:
Great place. Good signal.

Maybe there is another way to get here, but I got in by entering the Grand Canyon.

spots.name: Forest 525 Rd, close to Sedona
spots.notes: Functional internet. Great place in the desert.

spots.name: Freeport
spots.notes: Section of parking lot specifically for vans, campers, etc. Good place for staying in town for a while.

spots.name: Geopark - Pavilion Tektonik (parking)
spots.notes:
Seulement hors saison, only off season (October to May)

During season, can't park here and must pay for the actual camping just next to the parking lot.

spots.name: Goodenough Creek Campground
spots.notes:
Free with toilets.

Good signal, had a video call from the camp spot next to toilet.

The road goes deep down, but lower spots were taken and signal might be worse; didn't check.

There is also a spot just outside before this one and it is hidden by a barage of trees.

spots.name: Goose Spit Park
spots.notes:
For hanging out during the day only.

For sleeping, just go to the marina in Comox or street parking.

Wonderful place. Sunrise on one side and sunset on the other.

Access to toilet.
No parking from 23 to 5.

A lot of people come and go for paddleboarding and kayaking and sometimes, there are teenagers in the evening who use this place as a hang out spot.

spots.name: Government Wash Campground
spots.notes: The pass America The Beautiful got me in... Or am I confusing it with another place.

spots.name: Halte des piliers
spots.notes: Rest stop, good for one night.

spots.name: Hilltop Hot Springs
spots.notes: Good spot, good signal.

spots.name: Hilltop Hot Springs
spots.notes: Lower spot but better view of plains and cows and oxen. Good signal.

spots.name: Independence
spots.notes: Great hotspot signal.

spots.name: Inspiration point
spots.notes: Ok signal. Toilet stinks. Lots of people coming and going. Very much like belvédère on Mont-Royal in Montreal.

spots.name: June Lake
spots.notes:
Awesome 360 view. Great signal.

Only three spots at the top and it is sandy and steep. A big SUV was stuck and had to be towed while I was there.

spots.name: Knapper Camp BLM
spots.notes:
Good hotspot signal 17/8 11/6

Beautiful sunset when clouds aren't covering it.

Big space means people might come and stop here.

Cows and lake at a distance.

Easy to drive here.

spots.name: Lake Hawkins
spots.notes: Don't know if this is a good place for sleeping, but it was great for working in the morning and see sunrise until someone came and put on loud music.

spots.name: Liberty, Washington
spots.notes:
Big space. Lots of ATV, RV and trailers, but the space is so big it is easy to stay away from them.

Very weak signal. Less than 1/1 when I arrived Friday early evening, but later, it turned into 6/2 and it was 4/2 in the morning. It might have been a good place to stay for work, but I only stayed for one night.

This place is across from Liberty Campground where there is no signal.

spots.name: Long Jim Loop Camping
spots.notes: Many spots just before entering the Grand Canyon.

spots.name: Miami
spots.notes: Paid for this parking, so I could go out and just come back and sleep here after a night out.

spots.name: Naramata
spots.notes:
Good spot in the forest under trees. Some spots have views and some don't.

Signal is fine.

There are campers, hikers and mountain bike riders.

Bears could be around.

spots.name: NF-13
spots.notes:
Slow and weak signal.

Fine for doing little email things, but forget uploading videos.

Conference with 5 five had audio the whole time, but video was cutting.

spots.name: Old Sheldon Church Ruins
spots.notes: Parking for for the church in the middle of the forest. Very nice to sleep and work. Signal, not the best.

spots.name: Osage State Fishing Lake
spots.notes:
Very nice but very bad hotspot. Everything takes forever to load.
Two toilets.

spots.name: Park and ride
spots.notes: Just for sleeping.

spots.name: Parking lot (Seabrook Beach)
spots.notes: Beautiful view and beautiful sunset. Stayed two nights.

spots.name: Penrose Commons OHV
spots.notes:
Hotspot internet is great. Had a video call with 28 people.

Secluded, but less open in terms of getting a wide view.

Rocky roads

spots.name: Penrose Commons OHV
spots.notes:
Secluded even if it's next to the road. Great hotspot 29/7.

Motocross and ATV going around sometimes, especialy weekends, not so many on weekdays.

spots.name: Plage de la rivière
spots.notes:
Very nice and big beach.

Many people come for sunset, but nights and mornings are quiet.

spots.name: Public Beach
spots.notes:
Good signal.
Cramped if there are other campers (2.5 spots).
Some people walk by on the beach.

spots.name: Ranch Road
spots.notes: Good spot in the desert with good signal.

spots.name: Rest area in Michigan
spots.notes: This rest area was quite exceptional, because it is in the forest away from the road.

spots.name: French Prairie (Baldock) Northbound Rest Area, south of Portland, OR
spots.notes: Very nice and big. A good way to be in a city without being in a city.

spots.name: Rest area - Rte de Marcil
spots.notes: Worked all day. Beautiful sunrise.

spots.name: Rd 1005
spots.notes:
T-mobile signal. No AT&T.

Nice place full of mountains around, but lots of poop.

spots.name: Rosewood Landing (close to Myrtle Beach)
spots.notes: Mostly quiet just to sleep. Some cars came.

spots.name: Royal Beach, Colwood, Vancouver Island
spots.notes:
Good signal.
Great view of Victoria and the mountains of Washington State.

Toilets and drinkable water available. Also two volleyball courts.

Good place for hang out during the day.

For sleeping, use street parking just outside the beach.

spots.name: Saco
spots.notes: Blended in the parking lof of the train station for one night only.

spots.name: Sad Boulders
spots.notes: Good signal, not many people.

spots.name: Saddle Mountain Overlook
spots.notes: Good hotspot signal. Not many spots. Awesome view if you are lucky enough to get this spot.

spots.name: Shore Rd, Moran
spots.notes:
Ok signal. Don't know if staying here overnight is fine.

It was amazing to be here. Easy access to the beach. Great full moon.

spots.name: South Inlet, Delaware Seashore State Park (paid parking)
spots.notes: Paid parking. Stayed for only one night. Ok signal to work. Took a free shower and had a meal and a drink in the restaurant.

spots.name: South Lums Trailhead
spots.notes: Stayed for only one night. Ok signal to work. Toilets stink. There was one other camper, a VW.

spots.name: Stockton State Forest
spots.notes:
First spot
Good for camping
Bad for solar power
Hotspot 5/.75

spots.name: Dallas Road, Victoria
spots.notes:
Great place. Great view.

No signs here. Elsewhere on this road, many signs that have parking hours and limit, but this spot is good.

spots.name: Water Canyon Recreation Area - Winnemucca
spots.notes:
Good spot. Many spots but come early.

Weak signal, ok for light work.
Last spots deep inside have no signal.

Lots of flies on sunny days.

When cars pass by, dirt flies.
Fast drivers are assholes.

spots.name: Water Canyon Recreation Area - Winnemucca
spots.notes:
It's all right. It's kind of public, but easy access to the natural stream of water. Close to a pit toilet.

Signal is a big issue after sunset. Before sunset, it was ok, 10/1. After, it's .1/.1

20230615 0338 hotspot internet is 47/1.

spots.name: Woodland Park
spots.notes: Great spot, great view, usually great hotspot signal, sometimes slow, but usually recovers after 0-60 minutes.

spots.name: Woodland Park
spots.notes: Inclined, great hotspot

spots.name: Woodridge Primitive Park
spots.notes: Very bad hotspot. Everything takes forever to load. Nice for camping but not really vanlife. Vehicles must park and can not go on grass. It's like a rest area but for camping.

places.name: Belle Joli Winery Tasting Room, Deadwood
Belle Joli Winery Tasting Room, Deadwood
La Belle Patate
places.notes:
Excellent poutine.

This place has a Quebec vibe through its decor with old Quebec license plates and hockey things.

places.name: Mackinaw Trail Winery & Brewery Manistique On the Harbor
Meineke Car Care Center (auto repair shop)
places.notes:
At the time of this writing (2023-07-05), Google's marker is on the wrong building. It's actually the one at the back of the parking lot.

Mathew, Tiffany and Alex are great people and they did whatever they could to help with my exhaust problems.

places.name: Memorial Park, Portland, Oregon
places.notes: Nice place to spend a few hours or a day. For sleeping, I went to the rest area nearby.

places.name: Ragga Surf Cafe
places.notes: Good food by the beach. Good spot for working.

places.name: The Big Apple
places.notes: One last stop before reaching Quebec.

places.name: Wall Drug Store
places.notes: 5-cent coffee. A very strange place. Must visit.

starbucks.name: Starbucks, Colorado Springs
starbucks.notes: This is a nice one with two area away from the main room.

starbucks.name: Starbucks, Deadwood
starbucks.notes: Nice Starbucks that looks like a saloon.

water.name: Free water at gas station
water.notes: One spigot where regular cars go and one where RVs and trucks go.

water.name: Walmart
water.notes: Water at the back. 0.39 per gallon.
